intro: Vellozia ornithophila, commonly known as the bird-feeding vellozia, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiky appearance. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, cone-shaped inflorescences. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Vellozia ornithophila is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
